author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Employees Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has directed the employers to remit their PF and other dues by the 15th instant of every month.

Grace

period

A press release from S. Murugesan, Regional PF Commissioner II, issued here on Tuesday said that the employer, as per the Manual of Accounting Procedure, is also allowed a grace period of five days to remit the contribution, as the work procedure was manual.

At present era, employers compute the wages and EPF liabilities electronically and file electronic challan-cum-return.

The remittances are also being deposited through internet banking.

This has reduced the process and time taken in calculation of PF dues and its remittances in the bank.

Accordingly, it has been decided that concession of grace period of five days available to the employers for depositing the contribution and other dues for the month of January payable in the month of February, is withdrawn from February 2016.

As such, all the employers will now pay their PF and other dues by 15th instant, the release added.
title: EPFO announcement for employers
